items.title: Closing Bell: Sensex gains 222 points; Nifty holds above 25,400 as metal, bank stocks shine
items.summary: The BSE Sensex rose 221.69 points, or 0.27 per cent, to close at 82,566.37. The index had opened higher and moved in a narrow range during the session.

items.title: Piramal Pharma points to early recovery signs after seeing red in Q3
items.summary: The company posted its results for the third quarter of FY26 late on Wednesday evening, with its revenue dipping 3% year-on-year to  ₹2,140 crore, and slipping to a loss of  ₹136 crore from a net profit of  ₹4 crore in Q3FY25. Its ebitda margin shrank from 16% in Q3FY25 to 11% this fiscal.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex adds 222 points, Nifty above 25,400 as D-St recovers from early dip
items.summary: At the close, the Sensex was higher by 222 points, or 0.27%, to 82,566.37, and the Nifty gained 76 points, or 0.3%, to end at 25,418.90.

items.title: DII stake hits all-time high as foreign holdings shrink to 13-year low: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Survey noted that DIIs, especially mutual funds and insurance companies, have remained consistent net buyers of equities even during phases of foreign portfolio investor (FPI) selling. This steady domestic buying helped offset foreign outflows and supported market resilience.

items.title: Gold, silver prices to remain elevated amid global uncertainties: Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlighted that both gold and silver touched lifetime highs during 2025, reflecting heightened global uncertainty and strong safe-haven demand

items.title: How may the US Fed meeting outcome impact the RBI MPC meeting next month? Explained
items.summary: According to experts, the Federal FOMC's decision to keep rates unchanged has important implications for global monetary policy, including India.

items.title: Hindustan Copper surges 20% to hit fresh 52-week high as copper prices rally
items.summary: Over the past six months, Hindustan Copper shares have skyrocketed 190 per cent

items.title: Gold price rise hits jewellery demand in India, volumes fell 24% in 2025: World Gold Council
items.summary: India’s gold jewellery demand by volume fell sharply in 2025 as record prices curbed buying, with consumption dropping 24% year-on-year to 430.5 tonnes, according to the World Gold Council. However, higher prices pushed the value of India’s jewellery demand to a record $49 billion.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 calls for education reforms to stem student exodus, draw overseas learners
items.summary: With 28 Indian students going abroad for every one international student who chooses India, the Economic Survey said the country has officially emerged as the world’s largest source country for international students.&nbsp;

items.title: DIIs cushion Indian equities as FIIs stay net sellers: Economic Survey
items.summary: FIIs have been net sellers since July 2025, barring October and November. Even in January so far, FIIs have net sold Indian equities worth  ₹36,771.10 crore. Meanwhile, DIIs have been net buyers throughout 2025. In January so far, DIIs have purchased Indian shares worth  ₹67,183.01 crore.

items.title: Sensex gains 222 points, Nifty 50 ends above 25,400— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
items.summary: The Sensex jumped 222 points, or 0.27%, to close at 82,566.37, while the Nifty 50 settled at 25,418.90, up 76 points, or 0.30%. Mid and small-cap segments, however, underperformed as the BSE 150 Midcap index inched up by 0.10%, while the BSE 250 Smallcap index slipped 0.19%.

items.title: Economic Survey highlights need to strengthen industrial cluster strategy to compete globally, bats for reform-enabled ecosystem
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: Clusters designed under this framework may have the potential to become India's primary engines of growth, accelerating integration into global value chains and supporting the nation's economic growth and resilience, it said.

items.title: Digital addiction can hurt jobs, earnings and economy, warns Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlights the growing contribution of the digital economy, pegged at 11.74% of national income in FY23, which is projected to rise to 13.42% in FY25. However, this clashes with the negative impact it is having on the population.&nbsp;

items.title: Economic Survey views Sebi code as blueprint for regulatory reform
items.summary: The Economic Survey said the Securities Markets Code could reshape governance across India’s regulatory architecture.

items.title: Economic Survey flags concerns over fiscal populism in states
items.summary: The Economic Survey highlights growing worries about states' fiscal populism and rising revenue deficits. Unconditional cash transfers are expanding, potentially crowding out growth-enhancing spending. This fiscal indiscipline at the state level now affects India's sovereign borrowing costs. Coordinated fiscal discipline is crucial for productive capacity and income growth.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: High, rising mobility costs evident; RRTS expansion offers hope
items.summary: Cities need to prioritise the movement of people, not vehicles, notes Economic Survey 2025-2026

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: World faces copper shortage as AI data centres drive power demand
items.summary: India faces a looming copper shortage. Surging power demand from AI data centers is a key driver. Critical minerals are now strategic bottlenecks for the global energy transition. This impacts energy security and industrial competitiveness. Massive material requirements for renewable energy projects are also highlighted. India must prepare for significant investments.

items.title: Maruti margins look weak on paper, but per-car profitability holds up
items.summary: Margin compression appears sharper due to pricing and cost pass-through, but per-car profitability remains stable even as steel costs, export risks and valuation concerns weigh on sentiment.

items.title: Wheels India reports 48% increase in consolidated PAT to ₹37 crore in Q3’26
items.summary: The company announced an interim dividend of ₹5.3 per share, up from ₹4.5 per share in the previous year

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Rupee valuation does not accurately reflect India’s stellar economic fundamentals
items.summary: The rupee hit an all-time low of 92.00 against the American currency, weighed down by steady dollar demand and a cautious global mood

items.title: FPIs flow remained volatile in FY26 on global uncertainty, capital shift towards AI-hubs: Economic Survey
items.summary: As a result, there was a BOP deficit of $6.4 billion in H1 FY26 compared to a surplus of $23.8 billion in H1 FY25, which was funded by a decline in forex reserves

items.title: Over 3900% in 5 years! Multibagger small-cap stock RDB Infra board sets meeting date to consider and approve NSE listing
items.summary: RDB Infrastructure And Power's stock fluctuated on January 29, 2026, rising 4.5% to  ₹69.82 before dropping over 6%. The company will consider a direct NSE listing on February 3, 2026, following a 3900% rise in five years and recent strong returns.

items.title: FPIs flow remained volatile in FY26 on global uncertainty, capital shift towards AI-hubs: Eco Survey
items.summary: Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) flows in FY26 remained volatile, leading to a net outflow of USD 3.9 billion as of December 2025, driven by elevated uncertainty and increased capital allocation towards AI-centric markets such as the US, Taiwan, and Korea, the Economic Survey 2025-26 said on Thursday.

items.title: Airport expansion gathers pace as air traffic rises: Economic Survey
items.summary: Passenger traffic projected to grow from 412 million in FY25 to 665 million by FY31; greenfield airports and modernisation drive adding capacity

items.title: Economic Survey 2026:  ₹10.7 lakh crore raised through primary markets in FY26,  ₹1.6 lakh crore via mainboard IPOs
items.summary: Despite volatility in FY26, the Indian IPO market is thriving, attracting diverse companies and strong investor interest. The Economic Survey highlights a significant rise in resource mobilization, with total amounts reaching  ₹10.7 lakh crore, showcasing India's role in global capital formation.

items.title: SAMHI Hotels’ Q3 profit surges 111% profit to ₹48 crore despite GST headwinds
items.summary: However, the company’s shares fall 4 per cent on Thursday

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: India needs disciplined self-reliance, not blanket protectionism
items.summary: India must prepare for prolonged geopolitical uncertainty, trade disruption and capital volatility, which requires improved competitiveness and focus on advanced manufacturing, not just import substitution, says the Economic Survey 2025-26 &nbsp;

items.title: Economic Survey calls for tighter credit practices at microfinance institutions
items.summary: The Economic Survey also noted that while private equity and venture capital funding has fuelled the expansion of the microfinance sector, it has also been accompanied by recurring stress, including over-lending and over-indebtedness.

items.title: China reportedly drops rules that sparked property crisis, developer shares surge
items.summary: Chinese property developers are no longer required to report monthly data related to the country's "three red lines" policy, local media said on Thursday, an apparent end to rules which triggered a major debt crisis that continues to this day.

items.title: Economic Survey sees 1 in 5 chance of a scenario worse than 2008 financial crisis
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26, tabled in Parliament, outlines three possible global scenarios for 2026, warning that a systemic shock in financial, technological, and geopolitical spheres could have consequences worse than the 2008 crisis, while India’s domestic fundamentals remain resilient.

items.title: Brent oil price tops $70 on Trump's Iran threats
items.summary: Brent crude oil topped $70 per barrel Thursday for the first time since September as US President Donald Trump ramped up geopolitical tensions by threatening military strikes on Iran.  In London morning deals, international benchmark oil contract Brent North Sea crude jumped 2.4 percent to $70.06 per barrel.

items.title: Adani Power Q3 net profit declines 19% even as power sales edge up
items.summary: The net profit attributable to equity holders of the parent stood at ₹2,484 crore, compared with ₹3,057 crore in the corresponding quarter of FY25, the company said in a regulatory filing

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: How Kochi can show the 'way' to other cities
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the Kochi Water Metro as a model for sustainable urban transport. This project revitalizes inland waterways, offering cost-effective and green connectivity. It integrates with existing metro systems for seamless travel. The success of Kochi Water Metro is inspiring similar projects in 21 other Indian cities, transforming natural water assets into efficient urban infrastructure.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: CEA confident of India's 6.8%-7.2% growth aim for FY27 in real terms despite an upcoming tweak
items.summary: India's economy is set for robust growth in FY27, with projections between 6.8% and 7.2%. This strong momentum is fueled by solid domestic demand and easing inflation. Private consumption and investment activity are showing significant acceleration. These trends highlight a resilient Indian economy poised for sustained high growth, even with statistical adjustments.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Public and private hands must team up to deliver India’s next infra growth
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: India is making significant strides in infrastructure development, blending public investment with the dynamism of the private sector. This holistic approach is enhancing operational efficiency and connectivity across the nation. We can observe remarkable innovations in transportation—be it roads, railways, or aviation—as well as advancements in digital frameworks.

items.title: Kerala shows the way in integrating RE in grid
items.summary: To enable effective integration with the grid the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) now requires new connected households, as well as industrial and agricultural solar plants, to install battery storage capacities

items.title: European shares rise as miners, energy stocks lift sentiment
items.summary: European shares rebounded on Thursday, lifted by higher prices of oil and precious metals, shaking off the gloom from weaker luxury ‌earnings the ‌day before.

items.title: Retail investor participation in Indian capital markets sees a surge in FY26: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Survey noted that although net additions to the investor base moderated in the current fiscal, net inflows of domestic investors into equity markets remained resilient

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: India’s services sector emerged as a stabilising force amidst global uncertainty
items.summary: Going forward, sustaining India’s position in the global services market will depend on productivity gains, continued innovation, ongoing investment in skills.

items.title: Nestle Q3 Results Preview: Strong volumes to drive up to 11% YoY revenue growth; input costs to cap PAT upside
items.summary: Nestle India is expected to post steady Q3 revenue growth of about 10–11%, driven by healthy domestic volumes. However, higher input costs may weigh on margins, keeping profit growth modest despite continued focus on volume-led expansion and brand investments.

items.title: What the Economic Survey suggests to improve quality of life in Indian cities
items.summary: The economic potential of Indian cities remains untapped, and improving city administration, financing, and unlocking land banks can help decongest them.

items.title: India should cut tax on debt instruments to reduce cost of capital, economic adviser says
items.summary: India's annual economic survey recommends reducing the cost of capital by diversifying financing beyond banks and lowering taxes on debt instruments. The survey suggests reforms to strengthen long-term capital markets, including credit enhancement facilities and revised investment guidelines for long-term funds. It also advocates for a shift to activity-based regulation to prevent regulatory arbitrage.

items.title: Government notifies coking coal as Critical & Strategic Mineral
items.summary: The move is part of the ongoing structural reforms in the mining sector and in line with the vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat and Viksit Bharat 2047, Coal Ministry said

items.title: Private sector seeks anchor contracts as Dept of Space struggles to use funds
items.summary: The gap between what the industry wants and what the Department of Space needs has never been wider

items.title: Eco Survey flags critical lessons tariff-plagued India could learn from its pharma cos
items.summary: Economic Survey: The TRIPS shift had challenged the very foundation of India's competitive advantage, reverse engineering and cost-efficient process innovation. However, the manner in which the sector responded offers a compelling template for industries currently confronting Trump's tariffs, the survey noted.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Despite many skilling schemes, India has a results problem
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 flags low job retention and limited wage growth among trainees, pointing to a persistent gap between skilling efforts and labour-market outcomes.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for tackling rising digital addiction as it hits academic performance, productivity
items.summary: "A major challenge in addressing digital addiction in India is the lack of comprehensive national data on its prevalence and mental health effects,” it said.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for industrialization model with focus on global value chain
items.summary: This comes at a time when nations are coming together towards breaking the stranglehold of a single nation in supply chains with compacts, such as the US-led Pax Silica to release the grip of China on artificial intelligence supply chains

items.title: UK 10-year gilt yields rise to 2-month high after US Fed hold
items.summary: Ten-year British government bond ‍yields rose ​to their highest since ⁠November 20 on Thursday, tracking a modest upward move in U.S. Treasury yields after ‌the Federal ‌Reserve kept interest rates unchanged on Wednesday.

items.title: Infrastructure capex key to Viksit Bharat aim, private sector must step up
items.summary: The government has steadily raised public investments in infrastructure since FY20. It has risen from  ₹5.92 trillion in FY22 to  ₹11.21 trillion (budget estimate) in FY26. Public spending on infrastructure has a high multiplier effect, boosting growth rapidly, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: VOC Port forms joint venture with Tamil Nadu govt to set up shipbuilding cluster at Tuticorin
items.summary: V.O. Chidambaranar Port Authority has formed a special purpose vehicle for a mega shipbuilding cluster at Tuticorin. This joint venture with SIPCOT aims to boost India's commercial shipbuilding and repair capabilities. The initiative supports the Union Cabinet's scheme to expand domestic shipbuilding capacity and advance maritime infrastructure across the nation.

items.title: Euro zone bond yields steady as ECB euro strength concerns persist
items.summary: Euro zone bond yields held steady ‍on Thursday as concerns ​persisted over the strength of the euro ⁠and whether it might prompt the European Central Bank to cut interest rates, while the U.S. Federal Reserve kept rates unchanged.

items.title: Air India to order 30 Boeing Max Jets as travel demand surges
items.summary: Air India is set to confirm an order for 30 additional Boeing 737 Max aircraft at the Hyderabad airshow, finalising options placed in 2023 as part of its rapid fleet expansion amid surging air travel demand in India. The order builds on Air India’s earlier commitment to buy 470 aircraft from Boeing and Airbus, including 220 Boeing jets, most of which are being deployed by its low-cost arm, Air India Express. This follows the airline’s confirmation of 100 Airbus aircraft last year.

items.title: Gillette India profit jumps on demand for grooming products
items.summary: Gillette India's third-quarter profit jumped about 37% on ‍Thursday, as demand stayed ​robust for its staple men's grooming products, ⁠including shaving razors and creams.

items.title: Economic Survey: Labour reforms could add 1.25% to GDP by FY30
items.summary: Survey flags gains from higher formalisation, productivity and worker welfare

items.title: Composition of household financial savings has undergone a significant shift over the past decade: Economic Survey
items.summary: The household ownership share of deposits has decreased, while that of pension and insurance assets has remained almost unchanged over the period from FY19 to FY24

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Southern states leading on green ease of biz
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh are pioneering sustainable industrial growth, proving economic progress and environmental care can go hand-in-hand.  These states are integrating green initiatives with business reforms, boosting ease of doing business while championing renewable energy and pollution control.  Digital governance and streamlined processes are key to their success.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 urges policy action to raise women’s labour participation
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlighted the need to increase inclusivity, noting that one way to do so is by encouraging more women to enter male-dominated STEM fields

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Ban advertising of ultra-processed foods from 6 am-11 pm
items.summary: India faces a growing challenge with ultra-processed foods. The Economic Survey highlights rising obesity, especially in children. It proposes banning advertisements for these foods from morning to night. Restrictions on marketing infant milk are also suggested. This aims to curb unhealthy eating habits and improve public health across the nation.

items.title: Government needs a startup mindset, merely making rules isn't enough: Economic Survey
items.summary: Under such an approach, the state acts before certainty emerges, structures risk rather than avoiding it, learns systematically from experimentation, and corrects course without paralysis, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: Economic Survey pitches climate-resilient, market-linked reforms to boost farm incomes
items.summary: The survey emphasizes strengthening agriculture through reforms, climate-resilient practices, and private sector involvement. The sector, crucial for economic growth and employment, aims to increase productivity and sustainability while addressing challenges like climate change and water scarcity.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for proactive reforms to attract foreign investment
items.summary: India needs a strong plan to attract more foreign investment. The Economic Survey highlights the need for proactive reforms and targeted strategies. Engaging directly with global companies and offering reliable incentives are crucial. A single empowered center will make India a credible production hub. Sustaining FDI inflows amidst global uncertainty requires policy stability and aggressive investor engagement.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 advocates minimum per-task earnings for gig workers
items.summary: The gig economy continues to expand rapidly, yet income volatility remains a key issue, creating obstacles to credit access. Financial inclusion for gig workers also trails behind; they face limited 'thin-file' credit options, which continue to raise concerns

items.title: Economic Survey FY26: Energy transition should align with growth, security, institutional preparedness
items.summary: India's upcoming decade demands a pragmatic energy strategy. The focus is on balancing growth and security with renewable energy expansion. Dispatchable power remains crucial for industrial and social development. Strengthening transmission, distribution, and storage is key. India's international stance will emphasize predictable finance and technology flows. The nation is already boosting renewables and energy efficiency.

items.title: Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon in talks to invest up to $60 billion in OpenAI: Report
items.summary: Nvidia, an existing investor whose chips power OpenAI’s AI models, is in talks to invest up ​to $30 billion, The Information said

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: How Nashik luggage ecosystem beat European hubs
items.summary: India's manufacturing prowess hinges on industrial clusters, not isolated factories, according to the Economic Survey 2025-26. The Nashik Samsonite success story highlights how scale, supply chains, and skills converge. The survey advocates for upgrading cluster strategy with a focus on scale, institutional agility, and private sector execution to boost exports and innovation.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Livestock, fisheries drive new growth story in agriculture
items.summary: India's agriculture sector is central to future growth. The Economic Survey shows a shift towards value addition in livestock, fisheries, and horticulture. These allied activities are driving farm incomes and rural livelihoods. Foodgrain production continues to rise, ensuring food security. Horticulture is a bright spot, with India leading in several global productions.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Ethanol push risks squeezing pulses, oilseeds
items.summary: India's ethanol program has saved billions in foreign exchange. However, government policies favoring maize for ethanol are pushing farmers away from vital pulses and oilseeds. This shift raises serious concerns about the nation's food security and nutritional needs. The Economic Survey highlights this growing tension between energy self-reliance and food stability.

items.title: MIC Electronics bags ₹114 crore project to set up Common Facility Centre in Chhattisgarh
items.summary: The project will span 10 months and involve all aspects from design and engineering to procurement, construction, installation, testing, commissioning, and preparation for ongoing operations

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Industry experts hail India's GDP growth driven by domestic demand
items.summary: The Economic Survey highlights that India remains the fastest-growing major economy for the fourth consecutive year. The survey's insights show both the resilience and potential of various sectors in India.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India's civil aviation sector on sustained growth trajectory, says Survey
items.summary: India's aviation sector is soaring. Passenger numbers are rising, and airports are expanding. The nation aims to become a global aviation hub. More airports are being built, and air cargo is increasing. This growth signals strong economic connectivity. Opportunities exist in manufacturing, training, and leasing. Aviation services are vital for mobility and cargo.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Labour codes implementation to play key rule in supporting formal employment
items.summary: India has recorded significant employment growth in recent years, supported by structural reforms, tax rationalisation, and a sustained focus on skill development, it noted

items.title: India to unveil incentives for lithium, nickel processing, sources say
items.summary: India is set to boost its electric vehicle ambitions. The government will soon offer incentives for companies to build lithium and nickel processing plants. This move aims to increase output and meet growing demand for essential minerals. A 15% capital subsidy will be provided for eligible projects starting April 2026.

items.title: Indian markets offer value as Budget to keep fiscal path intact: Madhusudan Kela
items.summary: Market veteran Madhusudan Kela anticipates continued fiscal discipline despite a revenue gap. He highlights opportunities in market corrections, noting that individual stocks are becoming attractive after a period of consolidation. Kela also points to the strength of corporate India and sees potential in smaller companies for long-term investors. Investors are encouraged to focus on selective, long-term opportunities.

items.title: Nvidia boss hopeful of China allowing chip sales
items.summary: "I'm hoping... the Chinese government would allow Nvidia to sell (the) H200, so they have to decide, and I'm looking forward to a favourable decision," Huang said

items.title: India-EU FTA strategic signal to US, but gains hinge on efficiency: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee
items.summary: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee calls the India-EU free trade pact a strategic alignment. He believes it signals to the US that India and Europe do not need America as much as it thinks. However, Banerjee cautions that the deal will only bring benefits if India significantly boosts its efficiency and logistics.

items.title: Economic Survey backs voluntary crop diversification over MSP tweaks
items.summary: The Economic Survey proposes voluntary crop diversification instead of changing minimum support prices or reducing procurement. This strategy aims to align farm support with consumption patterns and national self-reliance. Savings from better stock management can fund attractive alternatives for farmers to grow crops like pulses, oilseeds, and maize. This approach protects food security and boosts farmer incomes.

items.title: SHANTI Act enables private sector participation in equipment manufacturing, R&D
items.summary: The SHANTI Act updates India’s nuclear legal framework, including the Atomic Energy Act of 1962 and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act of 2010, to permit private sector and state government participation previously banned by the 1962 Act, as per the Economic Survey for FY26

items.title: India's aviation fleet to triple in size in 10 years' time, Airbus says
items.summary: Indian aviation: Despite its size, India’s aviation market remains underpenetrated. Air travel stands at just 0.13 trips per person, far below levels seen in comparable regions, Jürgen Westermeier, Airbus president and managing director for India and South Asia, told news agencies.

items.title: What does Economic Survey 2025-26 reveal about India’s PSU disinvestment strategy?
items.summary: Strategic disinvestment in central public sector enterprises (CPSEs) has progressed in a calibrated manner over recent years, the Economic Survey 2025-26 presented by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Parliament said on Thursday.

items.title: Bank deposits shrink in household savings as MFs, equities gain ground: Economic Survey
items.summary: Bank deposits’ share of household financial savings has fallen sharply over a decade, while SIP flows, demat accounts and mutual fund participation hit record highs, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: RBI defers plan to mandate climate risk disclosures by banks, sources say
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has paused plans for banks to disclose climate change risks. This move impacts global efforts towards a low-carbon economy. The proposed rules, discussed since 2022, aimed for banks to report loan portfolio risks and mitigation strategies. Implementation was expected from fiscal year 2027. The central bank cited current priorities and potential costs for corporates.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Centre remains well on track to achieve 4.4% fiscal deficit target for FY26
items.summary: According to the survey, the central government's fiscal trajectory stands out for combining consolidation with sustained public investment, earning three sovereign rating upgrades this year

items.title: UGC New Equity Regulations Explained: Supreme Court stays new rules amid nationwide protests, 2012 norms to continue
items.summary: UGC New Equity Regulations Explained: The Supreme Court has stayed the UGC’s new equity regulations amid nationwide student protests, citing concerns over vague provisions and possible misuse. The court has directed that the 2012 UGC norms will continue to apply until further orders.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Access to housing finance grows over the years
items.summary: Access to housing finance has significantly improved. The share of housing loans to GDP reached 11% in FY25, up from 8% in FY15. Outstanding individual housing loans more than tripled in a decade. Demand-side measures and urban initiatives have boosted housing finance and demand. The real estate sector is in a sustained upcycle, driven by household savings and favourable affordability.

items.title: Adani Power Q3 Results: PAT down 18.9% YoY to  ₹2,479 crore; revenue fell 9%
items.summary: Adani Power Q3 Results: Adani Power reported an 18.9% decline in Q3 FY26 net profit at  ₹2,479.58 crore, down from  ₹3,057.21 crore. Revenue fell 8.9% to  ₹12,451 crore. Despite this, the company secured a new 3,200 MW power purchase agreement and maintained robust liquidity.

items.title: Economic survey proposes higher GST slabs for ultra-processed foods to combat childhood obesity
items.summary: The Economic Survey also recommended a potential marketing ban on ultra-processed foods between 6 am and 11 pm across all media platforms

items.title: Agriculture sector faces climate, water challenges despite growth: Economic Survey 2026
items.summary: India's agriculture sector is vital for national development. While growth is evident, challenges like climate change and productivity gaps persist. Reforms in fertilizers, research, irrigation, and crop diversification are essential. Strengthening farmer groups and digital platforms will boost transparency and access. Expanding high-growth areas like horticulture and dairy will drive inclusive economic development and job creation.

items.title: India–US Trade Deal| BTA could be ‘finalised any day now’ as negotiations edge closer: Report
items.summary: The BTA, which was formally proposed in February following directions from the leadership of both countries, aims to more than double bilateral trade from the current USD 191 billion to USD 500 billion by 2030.

items.title: Economy Survey proposes QCO framework aligned to industry readiness
items.summary: Overly narrow transition periods can unintentionally burden MSMEs that the QCOs are meant to support

items.title: Economic Survey calls for urea price hike, direct cash transfer to farmers
items.summary: Economic Survey: The proposed shift from input subsidy to income support aims to correct a three-decade-old imbalance in fertiliser use that is degrading soil quality and undermining crop yields, the document, tabled in Parliament on Thursday, stated.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 outlines 3 global market risks. Could it be worse than 2008 global financial crisis?
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 highlights significant global economic vulnerabilities, predicting three scenarios for 2026, including possible crises worse than the 2008 financial collapse. However, it notes that India will remain better off than most other countries.

items.title: Adani Power Q3 Results: Cons profit falls 19% YoY to Rs 2,480 crore, revenue down 9%
items.summary: Adani Power has announced its December quarter results. The company's consolidated net profit saw a significant 19% increase. This rise in profit is a positive development for the energy giant. However, revenue from operations experienced a slight decrease. Investors will be watching closely for future performance trends.

items.title: From multibaggers to laggards: 12 FY25 stars plunge up to 55% in FY26
items.summary: Here are the stocks that standout as multibaggers in FY25—rallying more than 100%—but have since slipped into the laggards’ camp in FY26.

items.title: Tesla invests $2 billion in Musk's xAI and reiterates Cybercab production starts this year
items.summary: Tesla said on Wednesday it will invest $2 billion in CEO Elon Musk’s AI company xAI

items.title: L&T’s confidence on order inflow comforts, but strong finish to FY26 hinges on execution
items.summary: Strong infrastructure-led order inflows lift visibility and stock sentiment, but weak execution and Middle East exposure remain key risks as L&amp;T chases revenue growth and margin stability.

items.title: Rupee punches below its weight as fundamentals clash with global headwinds, economic survey says
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 says the rupee is undervalued and “punching below its weight” despite India’s strong growth, controlled inflation and solid balance sheets. While the currency hit a record low near Rs 92 per dollar amid foreign outflows and global uncertainty.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Squeeze the 'orange' for more juice from India's concert economy
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the 'Orange Economy,' emphasizing live entertainment and concerts as significant growth drivers. The report identifies the concert economy's potential to boost urban services, tourism, and employment, while also noting existing bottlenecks like venue shortages and regulatory hurdles that need addressing for India to scale up this sector.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Why Gold matters now more than ever for Indian economy?
items.summary: The Economic Survey notes gold's resurgence in India as a strategic asset amidst global instability, with prices rising sharply due to geopolitical tensions and a weaker dollar. This increase has influenced inflation dynamics and bolstered the country's foreign exchange reserves.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Steel sector faces challenges of international price disparity, raw material security
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Economic Survey 2025-26 in the Lok Sabha on January 29, 2026

items.title: SET looks beyond fiction, backs global reality formats for weekday growth
items.summary: Sony Entertainment Television is shifting its focus to international reality shows for weekday programming. This strategy aims to attract more male viewers and premium advertisers. The channel is leveraging global formats like Wheel of Fortune to fill a weekday gap.

items.title: Centre remains well on track to achieve 4.4 pc fiscal deficit target for FY26: Survey
items.summary: India's government is set to achieve its fiscal deficit goal of 4.4 percent of GDP this financial year.  This achievement follows a period of fiscal consolidation and increased public investment.  The nation has seen three sovereign rating upgrades.  Markets have responded positively to the government's commitment to fiscal discipline.  This positive trend is expected to continue.

items.title: Gold and silver prices won’t lose their glitter just yet

items.title: TVS Motor Company shares in focus after Q3. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.summary: TVS Motor Company reported a robust 49% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 841 crore for the December quarter, driven by record sales and revenue. The two-wheeler major's overall sales grew 27% YoY to 15.44 lakh units, with strong performance across motorcycles, scooters, and international markets.

items.title: Meta to nearly double its investment in AI in 2026 as Mark Zuckerberg looks to build a ‘personal superintelligence’
items.summary: In its Q4 earnings report released on Wednesday, Meta revealed that its capital expenditure on AI for 2026 would be between $115 and $135 billion, almost twice the amount spent last year when the company revamped its AI unit.

items.title: Union Budget: India may pour more money & simplify tax regime to offset Trump tariffs
items.summary: Ahead of the Feb. 1 Budget, PM Modi’s government is expected to boost infrastructure spending and improve ease of doing business while maintaining fiscal discipline. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman may simplify import duties and ease compliance for small businesses, aiming to support growth amid muted private investment and global risks, including punitive US tariffs.

items.title: Is AI behind slow hiring in the US? Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell says…
items.summary: Noting that job gains remained low despite the US economy being on ‘firm footing’, Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell said there was ‘some connection’ between a sluggish labour market and artificial intelligence. However, he warned against rushing towards macroeconomic conclusions.

items.title: Microsoft shares drop 7% after record AI investments and slower cloud growth
items.summary: Investor concerns over the pace of spending versus returns pushed shares down about 7% in after-hours trading

items.title: RBI MPC 2026: Central Bank to keep interest rates steady at 5.25% throughout the year, says Reuters poll
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will maintain its key interest rate at 5.25% until 2026. Economists polled by Reuters expect the central bank to hold steady. This decision comes as the RBI assesses previous rate cuts and observes robust economic growth. Inflation remains below target. The focus is on ensuring policy transmission across the economy.

items.title: Civil Aviation Minister  holds  meetings with UAE, Saudi Arabia, Russia & Dominican Republic on  sidelines of Wings India 2026
items.summary: Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Kinjarapu met with delegations from the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Russia, and the Dominican Republic at Wings India 2026. India is becoming a global aviation hub, attracting partnerships and collaborations. The minister emphasized manufacturing, skills development, and sustainability. India aims to be a global exporter in civil aviation within a decade.

items.title: Norway’s $2.2 trillion fund pares holdings in top US tech stocks
items.summary: The fund trimmed more than 1,000 companies globally as part of a strategy to simplify its portfolio, while maintaining the US as its largest investment destination.

items.title: India-EU trade accord: Three aspects that’ll shape its success and four hoops it must jump through
items.summary: While the India-EU FTA clearly holds promise, its success will hinge on three aspects: manufacturing, mobility and non-tariff barriers. Even before we get to this test, the deal must clear multiple hurdles in Europe. Let’s not celebrate this trade pact too early.

items.title: Buzzing stocks today: Anil Ambani group, Tech Mahindra, HCL Tech, Thermax, Godrej Industries in focus
items.summary: IT, infrastructure and midcap stocks are in focus today as firms announce AI partnerships, capacity expansions, overseas moves and acquisitions. Tech Mahindra, HCLTech and PCBL Chemical saw action, while Anil Ambani group stocks drew attention after fresh enforcement action.

items.title: India set to push capex, ease business norms in budget amid US tariff risks
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is likely to step up public investment as private capex remains subdued, simplify import duties and ease compliance for small businesses.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 Key Highlights: Domestic economy remains on a stable footing, need ‘caution not pessimism’
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26 Highlights: The Economic Survey 2026 tabled today provides a snapshot of the Centre’s assessment of the economy and set the tone for its economic approach. Stay with our Economic Survey 2026 key highlights LIVE for latest updates.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | RBI’s bond-buying aims to soften yields as debt investors await India’s budget for cues
items.summary: In a rare move, RBI has advanced its bond purchases amid hardening yields on government bonds. Expectations of the budget due on Sunday could be weighing on market sentiment. Will the actual budget numbers calm bond investors?

items.title: Gold surges above $5,500 as debasement trade fuels record rally
items.summary: Concerns over heavy fiscal spending, turbulence in Japanese bonds and uncertainty around US currency policy have further pressured the dollar.

items.title: Poonawalla Fincorp rolls out five AI-powered enterprise solutions
items.summary: The new solutions span strategic decision making, customer onboarding, data quality, customer experience, and application development

items.title: Sensex Today | Stock Market Live Jan 29: Markets trade choppy amid mixed cues; Sensex, Nifty edge higher
items.summary: Sensex, Nifty, Share Price LIVE: Indian equity markets were choppy on Thursday, with mixed global cues and pre-Budget positioning keeping sentiment cautious. At 1:33 p.m., the Sensex was marginally higher by 76 points at 82,361, while the Nifty gained 17 points to 25,346.

items.title: TakeTwo raises pre-seed funding at ₹100 crore valuation
items.summary: TakeTwo offers full-stack, AI-driven visual storytelling, enabling cost-effective, high-quality VFX and stylised environments

items.title: Fed holds rates steady, sees job market stabilising
items.summary: Powell also defended the Fed’s independence amid mounting political pressure from President Donald Trump, declining to comment on investigations involving the central bank.

items.title: From Mexico City to Pretoria, India's car exports are running into turbulence
items.summary: Bad news for Maruti Suzuki and Hyundai Motor India, with South Africa exploring an increase in auto import duties after the tariff shock from Mexico last month. That too, at a time when they are increasingly relying on exports.&nbsp;

items.title: Budget: Time to put primary healthcare at the heart of India’s health system
items.summary: India has been witnessing a concerning trend where the proportion of public health expenditure going towards primary healthcare has declined, while spending on tertiary care has increased. This must be reversed. Strong primary healthcare is the foundation of an efficient and equitable health system.

items.title: India’s data centre boom turns to IPOs as AI-driven capex surges
items.summary: Sify’s IPO nod, Yotta’s domestic pivot and listing talk at Nxtra and CtrlS signal a shift toward public markets and partnerships to fund India’s next phase of data centre expansion.

items.title: Reliance, Capri Global to acquire Mumbai’s SevenHills Hospital
items.summary: Reliance Industries and Capri Global will acquire Mumbai’s 1,500-bed SevenHills Hospital, ending an eight-year impasse. The hospital will be converted into a not-for-profit entity, with funds infused via equity support.

items.title: India engaged with the US for trade agreement
items.summary: Having an FTA with the European Union enables a $30 billion common market between India and that region. However, a deal with the US is as important, if not more important, than a deal with the EU.&nbsp;

items.title: India protects mass-market cars, dairy and staples in EU trade pact
items.summary: India and the European Union have finalized a free trade agreement. Key sectors like mass market cars and farm produce are protected. Duty concessions will be introduced for specific EU vehicles over time. Indian apples will gain access to the EU market. This pact aims to boost trade between the two regions.

items.title: Government weighs raising EPFO wage ceiling to Rs 25,000 a month
items.summary: The government is considering a significant increase in the EPFO wage ceiling to Rs 25,000 from Rs 15,000, aiming to extend social security to more workers. This move, prompted by a Supreme Court directive, could boost the EPFO corpus but will reduce employees' take-home pay and increase employer costs.

items.title: At 7.8%, December IIP growth zooms to over two-year high
items.summary: India's industrial output surged to a 26-month high of 7.8% in December, propelled by robust manufacturing activity, GST rationalization, and a low-base effect. This strong performance, particularly in manufacturing, electricity, and mining, is expected to significantly boost upcoming GDP figures for the third quarter.

items.title: Ajit Pawar dies in crash; spotlight on poor charter safety
items.summary: A fatal Learjet crash in Baramati, killing Maharashtra's deputy chief minister, has exposed the concerning safety lapses among non-scheduled aviation operators. Experts point to widespread violations, including using expired components and falsifying records, driven by cost-cutting pressures. Many charter operators, unlike commercial airlines, operate with lean safety teams and often fly to remote airports with limited facilities, increasing risks.

items.title: Federal Reserve keeps interest rates unchanged even as Trump continues to insist they be lowered
items.summary: A key issue facing the Fed rate-setting committee is how long it will remain on hold; they remain split between those officials opposed to further cuts until inflation comes down and those who want to lower rates to further support hiring

items.title: Amazon layoffs: Tech giant to offer most US-based employees 90 days to look for new role internally
items.summary: As Amazon prepares to lay off 16,000 corporate employees, it has offered most US-based employees 90 days to look for a new role internally. This decision contributes to a total of 30,000 job reductions over three months as the company adapts to AI advancements and streamlines management layers.

items.title: The new logic of the Chinese economy
items.summary: It provides new opportunities for China-India cooperation

items.title: India’s ageing crisis: Why elder care needs stronger regulation and national standards
items.summary: Senior care facilities operate under a patchwork of state laws—many adapted from hospital, mental health or social welfare frameworks not designed for long-term elder care.

items.title: Drug misuse: Govt may curb 'Pregabalin' sales
items.summary: The government is looking to control the sale of Pregabalin. This common medicine is being misused. The government wants to make sure it is only sold with a doctor's prescription. This move follows concerns raised by authorities. Pregabalin is used for pain and seizures. Stricter rules are being considered to prevent its misuse.

items.title: FMCG majors turn to bulk buying during harvest season to cut costs, curb commodity price volatility
items.summary: These companies are also shifting from all-year round buying and instead acquiring raw materials in bulk during harvest seasons to reduce costs. High prices of wheat, edible oil, sugar, pulses, and other agri-commodities had squeezed margins at these companies last fiscal year.

items.title: Baramati plane crash likely to result in ₹50 crore claim, insurers say
items.summary: A fatal Learjet 45 crash near Pune, killing five, is expected to trigger insurance claims of approximately ₹50 crore. The aircraft, insured by ICICI Lombard, was attempting to land when it crashed. This follows another aviation insurance claim of ₹18 crore earlier this month.

items.title: Celebrity endorsements fall 22% in 2025 as brands shift to influencers
items.summary: Celebrity brand endorsements saw a significant 22% decline in 2025, marking the steepest drop. Companies are shifting budgets from expensive celebrities to influencers, including nano-influencers, to connect with GenZ consumers and achieve better campaign measurement. While celebrities remain important in some categories, the trend favors community-focused advertising.

items.title: Private banks step up write-offs despite benign NPA ratios in December quarter
items.summary: Indian private banks increased loan write-offs by over 22% in the December quarter. This move aims to clean balance sheets. Despite low reported bad loan ratios, underlying stress persists, especially in retail and unsecured lending. Banks are proactively managing credit costs. This trend highlights ongoing asset quality pressures that observers are watching closely.

items.title: PNB Housing Finance bets on affordable loans, margin focus under new MD
items.summary: PNB Housing Finance aims to balance growth and margins under a new leader with a five-year tenure, following frequent leadership changes. The company is shifting focus to higher-yielding affordable and mid-market housing loans, targeting a 45-50% share by FY28. This strategy, coupled with funding new developers, seeks to improve profitability and address investor concerns.

items.title: Inox Clean Energy raises ₹3,400 crore from NaBFID to refinance Vibrant Energy debt
items.summary: INOX Clean Energy is securing a ₹3,400 crore, 20-year loan from NaBFID to refinance debt post-acquisition of Macquarie's Vibrant Energy. This loan, priced between 8-8.50%, will be secured by seven solar, wind, and hybrid projects with long-term PPAs. The move aims to retire expensive debt and reduce the company's equity component.

items.title: Amazon Still Doesn’t Understand Brick-and-Mortar Retail
items.summary: The day Amazon.com Inc. announced in June 2017 that it was acquiring Whole Foods for almost $14 billion, employees of the natural grocer packed into the company’s Austin headquarters to meet their new bosses.

items.title: Bharat Petroleum will invest ₹25,000 crore towards City Gas Distribution in next five years
items.summary: Speaking to reporters, BPCL’s Business Head for Gas Rahul Tandon added they have already spent ₹8,000 in their 26 operational geographies

items.title: Turkish products excluded from India, EU FTA benefits
items.summary: Under the EU-Turkey Customs Union, Turkiye has to match the EU's common external tariff. So, when the EU lowers its tariffs for an FTA partner such as India, Turkiye would have to extend the same benefit to India.

items.title: Deccan Gold Mines may start drilling at critical mineral projects this quarter
items.summary: Deccan Gold Mines will begin drilling at its critical mineral projects in India and overseas this quarter. The company plans to establish small-scale processing facilities by mid-2027. DGM is exploring nickel, copper, and platinum group elements in Chhattisgarh. In Mozambique, focus will be on lithium, tantalum, and copper. A tungsten project in Spain is also advancing.

items.title: Deutsche Bank Deepens Emerging-Market Rebuild, Adds Two Traders
items.summary: Deutsche Bank AG is deepening its push into emerging-market credit, adding two executives in New York as part of an expansion that began last year and included the high-profile poaching of a star trader from a rival.

items.title: IEPFA plans faster payouts for low-value unclaimed shares, dividends
items.summary: Under the existing system, the authority then oversees claim settlements and verifications, with the relevant companies playing a key part in the stipulated processes. The proposed move aims to do away with further verification by the IEPFA in cases of low-value claims to ensure faster settlement, as per the draft rules firmed up by the authority.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki misses market estimates despite record quarterly sales
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki's third-quarter net profit rose 3.7 percent. This missed market expectations. Weak exports and a one-time provision impacted the results. However, the company achieved its best-ever quarterly net sales. Strong demand during the festive season and a GST reduction boosted sales. Domestic sales volume also reached a record high.

items.title: Budget 2026 wishlist: Manufacturing sector seeks tax relief, lower compliance costs
items.summary: Indian manufacturing CXOs prioritize tax relief and reduced compliance costs in the upcoming budget, with over half flagging it as a top concern. The survey also highlighted the need for demand-side support, faster approvals, and improved logistics, with MSMEs identified as requiring the most policy assistance.

items.title: IBC tweaks will align Indian laws with global regime: IBBI
items.summary: India's insolvency law is set for significant changes. These amendments aim to bring the system in line with global practices. The goal is to enhance the rescue of struggling companies. The Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India chairman highlighted these upcoming improvements.

items.title: ASML Investors Press Executives on Outlook Despite Bookings Beat
items.summary: ASML Holding NV failed to satisfy investors with record orders in the fourth quarter as analysts continued to question whether the Dutch semiconductor equipment maker can sustain its artificial intelligence-fueled momentum.

items.title: Micro lenders get Rs 8,000 crore credit guarantee boost amid funding stress
items.summary: This government backing aims to support the sector facing delinquencies and funding challenges. The scheme will incentivize banks to lend to microfinance institutions, especially smaller ones. It will be implemented outside the union budget framework and announced after Cabinet clearance.

items.title: Gold, Silver scale new peaks as dollar slips
items.summary: Gold and silver have hit record highs, fueled by strong demand and a dropped value of the US dollar. Escalating geopolitical tensions are also playing a significant role in this upward trend. Wealthy investors are turning to gold as a safe haven, while traders explore financing options for gold acquisitions.

items.title: Fertiliser imports rise as local production falls this fiscal year
items.summary: India significantly boosted fertilizer imports this fiscal year. Urea imports rose 85%, DAP 46%, and NPK 122%. This helped meet demand for key crop nutrition months. Urea sales increased despite lower domestic production. DAP sales saw a slight dip, but imports ensured availability. Complex fertilizer production grew, with imports more than doubling.

items.title: DERC norms: HC seeks Delhi government response on Tata Power plea
items.summary: Tata Power Delhi, a joint venture between the Delhi government and Tata Power Co., supplies electricity in Delhi's northern areas.

items.title: India, EU working to make FTA operational at earliest
items.summary: India and the European Union are pushing for an early operationalization of their free trade agreement. The deal, in the making for two decades, is expected to be in effect within a year. This agreement offers access to a massive EU market. India is actively engaging with EU stakeholders to expedite the process.

items.title: Global energy markets start 2026 with ample supply & stable prices: Dave Ernsberger, president of S&P Global Energy
items.summary: Global energy markets are starting 2026 with plentiful oil, gas, and renewable supplies. Prices are expected to remain stable, encouraging economic and demand growth. India is strategically discussing its energy mix. However, electricity transmission faces significant logistical hurdles due to rising power demand from data centers and AI infrastructure.

items.title: India set to ink 10-yr uranium supply deal during Canadian PM Mark Carney's visit
items.summary: Canadian PM Mark Carney's upcoming India visit in March is poised to secure a significant 10-year uranium supply deal worth 2.8 billion Canadian dollars. The trip also aims to finalize agreements for long-term energy supplies, including crude oil, LPG, and LNG, as well as critical minerals, seeking to reset bilateral ties.

items.title: India, US closer to trade deal? Official sources say ‘very significant’ progress in negotiations
items.summary: India and the United States are reportedly closer to an upcoming trade deal as there is ‘very significant’ progress in negotiations between the two countries. This comes amid the final stages of a free trade deal with the European Union.&nbsp;

items.title: Canada offers reliable energy supply to India amid global shake-up
items.summary: Canada is positioning itself as a dependable energy partner for India. Canadian energy minister Tim Hodgson stated Canada can supply crude oil, LNG, and LPG at competitive prices. This move aims to diversify Canada's energy exports beyond the United States. Canada sees energy as a key to doubling trade with India by 2030.

items.title: Going to aggressively pursue exploration in deepwater areas, says ONGC Exploration Director O.P. Sinha
items.summary: Mr. Sinha pointed out to policy support from the government and greater opportunities among the reasons for enhanced tilt to deepwater exploration

items.summary: "The rating upgrade reflects strong regulatory support, improving credit metrics and sustained deleveraging, supported by stable cash flows under a cost-plus regulatory framework," India Ratings said in a statement

items.summary: Upstream major ONGC will focus on exploration activities along the east coast, including the Mahanadi, Krishna-Godavari (KG) and Cauvery basins, and off the coast of the Andamans. It also struck a resource-sharing pact with RIL.

Excluding that one-time provision, profit rose by a third y-o-y to  ₹4,406 crore.

items.title: India-US trade talks continue in cordial atmosphere: Official
items.summary: India and the US are engaged in highly cordial trade negotiations, with a US delegation visiting New Delhi for talks. Both nations are working to finalize the initial phase of a bilateral trade agreement. This visit follows the imposition of tariffs on Indian goods due to their purchase of Russian crude oil.

items.title: Dairy sector, sensitive farm products fully protected in India-EU FTA, says Commerce Dept

Adopting such a measure would bring India in line with global best practices, as countries like the United States, China, France, United Kingdom, South Africa and members of the European Union regularly release seasonally adjusted IIP figures.

Import duty concessions for passenger vehicles above Rs 25 lakh will be phased in with annual quotas.  This move aims to encourage EU manufacturers to launch new models and gradually start local manufacturing in India.  Auto part concessions will also be reduced over time.

items.title: HT Media Q3 loss at  ₹23.7 crore on new labour codes

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits

Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.
